name: The Grimalkin's Revenge
tagline: Grinning faces seem to manifest in tussocks, clouds, and puddles, vanishing when looked at directly.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 2-in-6 likely to be with Hilda, furtively travelling between the Ogre Lair and the Secret Cave
procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d6 portions of Groaning Mandrake (p430), in addition to the normal results

description: After some travel along Downs Road, the party encounters the grimalkin Prissy Longtail, pacing in a circle and mumbling to herself. Grinning faces seem to manifest in tussocks, clouds, and puddles, vanishing when looked at directly.

points_of_interest.name: The Ogre Lair
points_of_interest.description: In a bare hillside overlooking the road looms the mouth of a foul, bone-choked cave. A stubby chimney sits atop the hill.
points_of_interest.interior: A clan of 7 ogres inhabit this cave: an enormous, cruel matriarch named Aldheid (maximum HP, +1 bonus to Attack and Damage Rolls), 5 loutish and cantankerous sons, and a gentle-natured human daughter, Hilda.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: A clan of 7 ogres (DMB): an enormous, cruel matriarch named Aldheid (maximum HP, +1 bonus to Attack and Damage Rolls), 5 loutish and cantankerous sons, and a gentle-natured human daughter, Hilda. All are present except possibly Hilda, who has a 3-in-6 chance of being in the Secret Cave, from which she returns in 1d3 Turns.
special_features: Under a pile of filthy, maggoty furs is a crude hole in the cave floor

points_of_interest.name: The Secret Cave
points_of_interest.description: A mile away from the ogres' lair is another cave. Unknown to all, Hilda saved one of Prissy's kittens, and has brought it here to grow up far from the slavering jaws of the ogre family.
points_of_interest.interior: Some canisters of dead mice and some crude wooden toys.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: A single grimalkin kitten, which Hilda calls Tommy Fluffkin. There is a 3-in-6 chance that Hilda is here, feeding the kitten and cleaning the cave.
secrets: Contains Tommy Fluffkin, the surviving grimalkin kitten

npcs.name: Prissy Longtail
npcs.title: Level 4 Thief
npcs.description: A chubby, sprightly, white-furred grimalkin woman with goggling blue eyes. Witlessly pacing the hills of this hex since the loss of her children, her fur is matted, her dress rumpled and torn, and her armour ragged.
demeanor: alternates between mournful, vengeful, and calculating
desires: Utterly committed to the destruction of the ogres, to the point of bloodthirsty obsession
secrets: Her litter were all killed and eaten by a clan of ogres
Has taken terrible oaths and sworn vengeance on the ogres
npcs.location: Pacing in a circle along Downs Road

npcs.name: Hilda
npcs.description: A 6′ tall, beautiful, golden-haired young human woman. Should PCs attack her clan, Hilda does not protect her family, but cries and grieves over their deaths. Given a chance, she tells Prissy about her remaining child, if the crazed grimalkin doesn't kill her first. She also freely offers the family's treasure to Prissy as wergild.
demeanor: Gentle disposition, unlike the rest of her family
desires: To guide her family away from its brutal ways, or at least find a way of living her own life
secrets: Saved one of Prissy's kittens and hides it in the Secret Cave
npcs.location: The Ogre Lair or The Secret Cave

items.name: Golden locket
items.description: Contains a perfect cloisonné image of Chateau Mauvesse
items.location: Under pile of filthy, maggoty furs in crude hole in cave floor

items.name: Sapphires
items.location: Under pile of filthy, maggoty furs in crude hole in cave floor

items.name: Gold pieces
items.location: Under pile of filthy, maggoty furs in crude hole in cave floor

secrets: Tommy Fluffkin, the surviving grimalkin kitten, is hidden in the Secret Cave
dm_notes: Prissy's plan: She accurately describes the lair as a cave in a nearby hill. She says the party need only distract the ogres, so that she can enter the lair via its chimney and strike from the rear. The party is free to keep all the ogres' treasure. If the party follows her plan, Prissy proceeds to the chimney, but reneges on her promise to attack, waiting first to see how the adventurers fare. Only if PCs slay at least four of the ogres does she join in.
